text: Saddle Mountain is a large, conical mountain located on the western side of the West Elk Mountains southeast of Crawford, Colorado. Topped off by North and South Saddle peaks, Saddle Mountain's highest point, South Saddle Peak, has an elevation of with over of vertical relief above the valley below. Although it has the classic shape of an extinct volcano, Saddle Mountain is an exposed igneous intrusion that geologists call a laccolith. ==References== ==External links== *Topographical map Category:West Elk Mountains Category:Mountains of Delta County, Colorado Category:Gunnison National Forest Category:North American 3000 m summits
title: Saddle Mountain (Delta County, Colorado)
